Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.gui

Class GUI

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.gui.GUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
View
public class GUI
extends java.lang.Object
implements View
This class implements the View for the GUI

    • displayError

      public void displayError​(int errorId, boolean isFatalError)
      Displays an error message.

      If the error is a fatal error it is displayed in the ErrorScene. Otherwise the error is visible in the BoardScene as a notification.

      Specified by:
      displayError in interface View
      Parameters:
      errorId - error ID
      isFatalError - true if it's fatal error

    • displayBoard

      public void displayBoard​(SerializableUpdateActions update)
      Displays the changes of the board.

      Tells the BoardSceneController where to add a new building and where to add or remove workers.

      Specified by:
      displayBoard in interface View
      Parameters:
      update - holds the information for possible moves and proprieties of the workers

    • displayBoard

      public void displayBoard​(SerializableUpdateInitializeWorkerPositions update)
      Displays the changes to the board in the initial phase of the game.

      It updates the board with the initial positions of the workers.

      Specified by:
      displayBoard in interface View
      Parameters:
      update - holds the information for possible moves and proprieties of the workers

    • askForAction

      public void askForAction​(SerializableRequestAction object)
      Handles the information for the GUI about the possible action a player can make.

      It tells the BoardSceneController if and where a worker can move/build, if they can end the turn or if they can build a dome

      Specified by:
      askForAction in interface View
      Parameters:
      object - holds the information for possible moves and proprieties of the workers

    • askForInitialGodPower

      public void askForInitialGodPower​(java.util.List<GodCard> godPowers)
      Displays the ChoosingGodPowerScene and adds the GodCards to the GUI cache
      Specified by:
      askForInitialGodPower in interface View
      Parameters:
      godPowers - the list of possible GodCards to choose from for the players

    • askForInitialWorkerPositions

      public void askForInitialWorkerPositions​(java.util.List<Position> possiblePositions)
      Sets the BoardSceneController into the phase when the player need to choose their workers first positions

      The actionCode of BoardSceneController is set to 1

      Specified by:
      askForInitialWorkerPositions in interface View
      Parameters:
      possiblePositions - List<Position> of the possible positions for the workers

    • askForStartupInfos

      public void askForStartupInfos​(int errorId)
      Displays the LoginSceneController when the main javafx application is ready. The player can insert their name and choose the number of players of the match. If the name of the player is invalid, the LoginScene is shown again, with an error notification
      Specified by:
      askForStartupInfos in interface View
      Parameters:
      errorId -

    • getWorkerPositions

      public Position getWorkerPositions​(int playerID, int workerID)
      Gets the Position of a worker
      Parameters:
      playerID - the PlayerID of the player
      workerID - the workerID of the worker
      Returns:
      the Position
